title: Cannot pin extensions to toolbar
content:
Recently I am no longer able to pin extensions to the tool bar.

I click on the puzzle piece and get to the list of installed extensions. Next to each extension I click on the three dots to get to the pull down menu, and it only shows remove, report and manage. Within manage there is nothing about pinning.

I went through this with the support group for one of my extension thinking it was an issue with them,, but after troubleshooting with them they say it is an issue with Firefox.

Sam issue in private windows, and same issue in troubleshoot mode.

Firefox 134.0.1 (64bit); Windows 11

I was able to pin extensions in the past. Is this because of a recent automatic Firefox upgrade? Any know solutions? Thanks
creator: les.eisenberg

title: Getting PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR on more sites
content:
For the past few months, I've been getting this error and been searching for possible solutions. None of which have worked. I am also not using Kaspersky AV. With this, I'm asking if there's anything else I can do.

Here are the solutions I've tried: 1. Troubleshoot mode / disabling add ons 2. New profile 3. Clearing cache / cookies / dns 4. Changing "DNS over HTTPS" & proxy settings 5. Disabling firewall / AV / VPN 6. Chrome loads the site but I do not want to resort to this. Using developer mode browser does not work either for firefox.
creator: dsicher

title: An address bar search engine is not using the correct icon.
content:
Some time recently the search engine icon for Wolfram Alpha, on the drop down from my address bar, disappeared and changed to a gray circle with a white magnifying glass in it.

I've tried clearing startup cache, didn't fix it; removing the WolframAlpha Search Engine extension, restarting Firefox, then adding the extension again, didn't fix it. I'm afraid I'm already about out of ideas.

How do I get it to stop being that gray magnifying glass thing, and go back to Spikey?
creator: PAGulley

title: Google sign in tasking forever on Firefox desktop
content: So, I'm trying to sign in to D&D Beyond with my google account. It works fine on my phone but when I try to do it on my desktop it just endlessly loads. I've already tried turning my pc off and on again and clearing cookies. Has anyone else had a similar problem.
creator: rpeferns

title: Right Click Menu is Broken
content: My Firefox desktop app recently updated. After it updated, I now cannot access anything by right clicking. When I right click, a giant window of options shows up (see image). It doesn't change no matter what I click on. When I try to select something in the giant window of options, nothing happens. I'm having a very hard time with it, particularly because I can't open links into new tabs now.
creator: apoquogue
